TopicTitle: switchting from vertical to horizontal and vice versa

Articles.Content:
I was wondering this.

lets say i have a normal ship designed. normal in the way that it has a control pod at the top, , engines and whatnot.

topdown construction.

then I attach a docking port in the "back( or the side, depends on who you look at it)

when i now fly that thing and chose the docking port and say "control from here"...

will the navball adjust and such ?

could I use that mechanic to land a rocket not vertically but horzontally ?

thx in advance
Yes the navball considers the direction the command pod or docking port faces to be the front of the craft. So the navball changes to match.

Yes, the navball adjusts. RCS and torque controls adjust too. The only thing that won't adjust is the engine so if you're not careful you may start accelerating in very different direction than you intend to.
